That statement was short, but it sure wasn‚Äôt accurate - it was a lie meant to cover up the truth about meetings between President Trump‚Äôs top campaign advisers and Russian operatives peddling damaging information about his political opponent.

The President‚Äôs lawyers contend that having him testify ‚Äúdemeans the office.‚Äù No. This President‚Äôs actions demean the office, and this absurd assertion demeans our entire system of law.
Special Counsel cannot be dissuaded or deterred from subpoenaing President Trump by lawyers' fallacious, farcical memo. Uncover the truth. Follow the facts and law.
The legal assertions in this document are no longer laughable - they are terrifying to anyone who believes in the rule of law.
President Trump‚Äôs lawyers cite out-of-date statutes, magical legal thinking&unconstitutional assumptions, but ignore this core truth: no one is above the law.
Donald in Wonderland: through a legal looking glass, no President can be prosecuted because whatever he says is the law. Too absurd even for fiction. In fact, no one is above the law.
